Experienced in multiple aspects of game design, graphic design, producer related tasks and quality assurance. Visit my portfolio 'www.bryandekker.com' for more information.

awards.title: Best Game Design award with team: Rockitbit
awards.description:
HKU Games and Interaction organised the Global Game Jam for the ninth time. This year for the first time at their new location in Utrecht. 17 teams worked day and night at their appointed office to create a game with the theme 'Waves'

Best Game Design award - team Rockitbit with the game Carnyx - the sound of slaughter.

awards.title: 1st place with team: Knights of Pi
awards.description:
On 30th November 2016, the third edition of the JamToday fair took place in Florence, Italy in collaboration and with the support of the Transmango project.  This year’s edition was co-located with the European League of Institutes in the Arts’ Biennial Conference and was kindly hosted by IED-Firenze.

Mathopia by KNIGHTS OF PI from JamToday Game Jam Utrecht 2016 was evaluated as the best game in the 2016 edition of the JamToday Game Jam Network.

awards.title: 1st place with team: Knights of Pi
awards.description:
The winner of both the audience and the jury award was Knights op Pi who developed a prototype where computational skills were needed to build a village with different levels. It is designed so that players are subtly nudged to multiply, divide and use other computational methods. Gameplay difficulty increases per assignment.

Ina van der Brug (HKU): “Last week’s game jam chose a challenging theme where teams, jury members and other audience members and organisers became inspired…working together with students from different disciplinary backgrounds and experts combining the themes of teaching, mathematics and game design, which lead to beautiful concepts”.

The winners of the Game Jam have the chance to showcase their game in Florence and share experiences with other teams in front of a European JamToday Commission.

awards.title: 1st place with team: Beasts Collide
awards.description: In recognition of their participation in the Living Lab Game Jam 2015 for outstanding team work and creativity in developing applied games and contributing to knowledge sharing between the Netherlands and Korea.

projects.title: Global Game Jam NL 2017
projects.description:
Carnyx - The sound of Slaughter is a real-time strategy game where you send berserkers to their deaths by blowing your gigantic war horn. The game is inspired by the ancient history of the Low Lands, where celtic tribes that lived south of the Rhine, according to Julius Caesar in his Bello Gallico, employed a beastlike warhorn in battle called a 'carnyx', an impressive instrument used to strike fear into the hearts of their enemies.

The Global Game Jam® (GGJ) is the world's largest game jam event (game creation) taking place around the world at physical locations. Think of it as a hackathon focused on game development. It is the growth of an idea that in today’s heavily connected world, we could come together, be creative, share experiences and express ourselves in a multitude of ways using video games – it is very universal. The weekend stirs a global creative buzz in games, while at the same time exploring the process of development, be it programming, iterative design, narrative exploration or artistic expression. It is all condensed into a 48 hour development cycle. The GGJ encourages people with all kinds of backgrounds to participate and contribute to this global spread of game development and creativity.

contributors.headline: Game Designer at Team6 Game Studios

projects.title: JamToday game jam Utrecht 2016
projects.description: Students from ROC Midden Nederland, HKU University of the Arts Utrecht and Saxion University of Applied Sciences, worked together with experts in the field of game design, mathematics and education, to create a math game in the span of 48 hours. The theme was Math: The Final Countdown and was organised in the context of JamToday, a European network aimed at sharing knowledge and expertise about applied game design.

projects.description: The Living Lab Game Jam is an incubator for applied games while providing a platform for intercultural exchange through game development.

projects.title: Global Game Jam NL 2015
projects.description:
Okapi & Dikdik live in a parallel universe, but a curious development unfolds when they start to break the doors of reality. Play with a friend and work together to advance through different levels. The world is sometimes not what it seems and you need your friend to guide you while watching his side of the screen.

The Global Game Jam (GGJ) is the world's largest game jam event (game creation) taking place around the world at physical locations. Think of it as a hackathon focused on game development. It is the growth of an idea that in today’s heavily connected world, we could come together, be creative, share experiences and express ourselves in a multitude of ways using video games – it is very universal. The weekend stirs a global creative buzz in games, while at the same time exploring the process of development, be it programming, iterative design, narrative exploration or artistic expression. It is all condensed into a 48 hour development cycle. The GGJ encourages people with all kinds of backgrounds to participate and contribute to this global spread of game development and creativity.

contributors.headline: Game Designer at Team6 Game Studios

projects.title: Voggel
projects.description:
The Game:
Voggel is a local multiplayer game about birds where you battle other players by stealing birds from their flock.

Voggel is best played with 4 friends on the couch and involves elbow thrusts and vile language during gameplay! Create your own bird and compete against your friends in several levels. Acquire new parts, colors and levels to make more combinations and explore the world!

Features:
- Compete with up to 4 players. 
- Quirky and unique gameplay based around breaking, stealing and destroying. 
- Create your own bird and lead your flock into battle. 
- Unique art style. 
- Travel around the world and explore all the levels with all their unique gameplay elements.

contributors.headline: Game Designer at Team6 Game Studios

profile_positions.description:
Team6 was born over 20 years ago. Born from passion for making games, we have grown to be one of the biggest independent studios in the Netherlands. One thing has never changed, the passion that kicked it all off is still our core fundamental that we bring to every game.

Team6 is based in Assen in the Netherlands. With over 35 family members, who each bring their A-game every single day, the experience we bring for every project makes us a valuable partner for many clients that put their trust in us. In our history, we have developed for almost every platform: from handhelds and VR, to mobile and next-gen consoles.
